1.text: Rinse the cherries with cool water.

2.text: Dry off the fruit with a paper towel.

3.text: Take the pits out of each cherry.

4.text: Set a rack on the bottom of a cookie sheet.

5.text: Place a sheet of parchment paper over the rack.

6.text: Take the stems out of each cherry.

7.text: Arrange the cherries onto the parchment paper.

9.text: Bag the cherries and freeze them for 6 months.

10.text: Remove the stems from 6 cups (1350 g) of cherries.

11.text: Stir some sugar into 4 cups (950 mL) of water to make the syrup.

12.text: Add 0.5 teaspoons (2.5 mL) of ascorbic acid to the syrup.

13.text: Place cherries in a freezer-safe jar or bag.

14.text: Pour the cooled syrup into the bag so all of the cherries are covered.

15.text: Freeze and use the cherries within 12 months.

16.text: Place 1.5 pounds (680 g) of cherries into a large bowl.

17.text: Add sugar to the cherries and let it dissolve.

18.text: Pour the cherries into a separate container.

19.text: Use the cherries within 1 year for optimal freshness.
